com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.widgets

Class MapWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.widgets.MapWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable, MapDisplayEvents
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapWidgetButton, MapWidgetRoot, MapWidgetTabView, MapWidgetTabView.Tab, MapWidgetText, MapWidgetWindow

    public class MapWidget
extends java.lang.Object
implements MapDisplayEvents
    A single rectangular element on the map

      • onDetached

        public void onDetached()
        Called when a widget is removed from a map display
        Specified by:
        onDetached in interface MapDisplayEvents

      • onActivate

        public void onActivate()
        Called right after the user presses spacebar to 'enter' this widget. This function is only called when setFocusable(boolean) is set to true. By default this function will activate and enter the element, allowing input to be handled by this widget. By overriding this base functionality can be disabled.

      • onDeactivate

        public void onDeactivate()
        Called right before a new widget becomes activated when this widget was previously activated. This method is always called at most once after onActivate() is called.

      • onFocus

        public void onFocus()
        Called right after this item is focused using W/A/S/D navigation controls

      • onBlur

        public void onBlur()
        Called right before this item loses the focus

      • onTick

        public void onTick()
        Called every tick to refresh this widget. The base #update() automatically calls onDraw() when the widget is invalidated.
        Specified by:
        onTick in interface Tickable
        Specified by:
        onTick in interface MapDisplayEvents

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw()
        Called when the widget should be re-drawn onto the map display. When this is called, the old area the widget was displayed has already been cleared.

      • onBoundsChanged

        public void onBoundsChanged()
        Called when the bounding box area of this widget was changed

      • getParent

        public final MapWidget getParent()
        Gets the parent node of this widget
        Returns:
        parent node, null if this is the root node

      • getNextInputWidget

        public final MapWidget getNextInputWidget()
        Gets the child widget to which keyboard/mouse input and events are redirected
        Returns:
        next input widget

      • setDepthOffset

        public final void setDepthOffset(int z)
        Changes the depth offset of this widget relative to the parent. By increasing this value it can be ensured that this widget sits on top of another widget. The default depth offset is 0, putting it on equal depth as other children.
        Parameters:
        z - depth offset

      • isFocusable

        public final boolean isFocusable()
        Gets whether or not it is possible for this widget to be focused
        Returns:
        True if this widget can receive focus

      • setFocusable

        public final void setFocusable(boolean focusable)
        Sets whether or not it is possible for this widget to be focused
        Parameters:
        focusable - to set to

      • isFocused

        public final boolean isFocused()
        Gets whether this widget currently has focus. The focused widget is the widget which will be activated when the user presses spacebar.
        Returns:
        True if focused

      • focus

        public final void focus()
        Gives this widget the focus. When the user presses spacebar, this will be the widget that is activated.

      • isActivated

        public final boolean isActivated()
        Gets whether this widget has been activated. All the focusable children of the activated widget can be switched between using W/A/S/D. Only focusable widgets can become activated.
        Returns:
        True if activated

      • activate

        public final void activate()
        Activates this widget, but only when the widget is enabled. Equivalent to calling onActivate() directly.

      • deactivate

        public final void deactivate()
        If this widget or a child thereof is activated, this method de-activates that widget. It will in turn activate a parent of this widget.

      • isNavigableFocus

        public final boolean isNavigableFocus()
        Gets whether this map widget is a potential widget that can be focused by navigating using W/A/S/D. If true, this widget can be focused without changing the activated widget. If false, the widget can only be focused by changing the currently activated widget.

        If this widget is not isFocusable() this always returns false.
        Returns:
        True if this widget can be focused by navigating to it

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled()
        Gets whether this widget is currently enabled using #setEnabled(enabled). If the parent of this widget is not enabled, this method returns false as well.
        Returns:
        True if this widget and the parent widgets are enabled

      • setEnabled

        public final MapWidget setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this widget is currently enabled. If a parent of this widget is not enabled, then isEnabled() will continue to return false.
        Parameters:
        enabled -
        Returns:
        this widget

      • getWidgets

        public final java.util.List<MapWidget> getWidgets()
        Gets an immutable list of children of this widget. These children are drawn on top of this widget. The returned list is guaranteed to be left unmodified when additional children are added or removed from this widget, making it safe to use for iterating.
        Returns:
        list of children

      • getWidget

        public final MapWidget getWidget(int index)
        Gets a widget stored at a particular index in the list of child widgets. Returns null if no widget is stored at this index.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        widget at the index

      • getWidgetCount

        public final int getWidgetCount()
        Gets the number of child widgets
        Returns:
        widget count

      • removeWidget

        public final void removeWidget()
        Removes this widget from its parent. If this widget or a child thereof was previously focused, the focus will automatically switch to the appropriate alternative. This method is equivalent to calling: 
         widget.getParent().removeWidget(widget);

      • clearWidgets

        public final void clearWidgets()
        Removes all previously added widgets

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        input widget (can be used for chaining calls)

      • swapWidget

        public final <T extends MapWidget> T swapWidget(MapWidget oldWidget,
                                                T newWidget)
        Replaces a widget with a new widget at the exact same index. If the old widget is not contained, the new widget is added instead.
        Parameters:
        oldWidget - to replace
        newWidget - to replace oldWidget with
        Returns:
        newWidget (for chained calls)

      • removeWidget

        public final boolean removeWidget(MapWidget widget)
        Removes a child widget from this widget. The old area the widget occupied is cleared.
        Parameters:
        child - to remove
        Returns:
        True if the child widget was removed

      • setRetainChildWidgets

        public final MapWidget setRetainChildWidgets(boolean retain)
        Sets whether child widgets are retained when this widget is removed from a parent. When retained, the child widgets are re-added when this widget is re-attached to a parent.
        Parameters:
        retain - whether to retain the widgets
        Returns:
        this map widget

        argument - for the status change

      • performTickUpdates

        public final void performTickUpdates()
        Performs onTick() and onDraw() update operations, and other widget refreshing logic needed to run in the background. Attaches newly added widgets before any updates are performed. This method is called by the internal implementation.

      • onStatusChanged

        public void onStatusChanged(MapStatusEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: MapDisplayEvents
        Callback function called when a widget in the map display wishes to broadcast a status change. These status changes can be used to refresh the map or apply updated configurations.
        Specified by:
        onStatusChanged in interface MapDisplayEvents

        event - of the status change
